column1: #text=Malus ( /ˈmeɪləs/[3 ] or /ˈmæləs/ ) , apple , is a genus of about 30 – 55 species[4 ] of small deciduous trees or shrubs in the family Rosaceae , including the domesticated orchard apple ( M. domestica ) . The other species are generally known as crabapples , crab apples , crabs , or wild apples
#text=The genus is native to the temperate zone of the Northern Hemisphere
